main.h1: Regulations on obligations for air carriers in connection to international flights

article.article: The purpose of these regulations is to clarify the obligation for all air carriers conducting international flights to Norway to verify that passengers have the necessary documentation for entry into Norway.
These regulations contain mandatory action for air carriers conducting international passenger flights to Norway, both commercial and non-commercial, scheduled and non-scheduled flights.

article.h2: Section 3. Obligation to verify entry registration
article.article: Passengers above the age of 16 must according to the Covid-19 regulations, register entry before arrival in Norway. The air carrier must verify before leaving the departure airport that all passengers to Norway are registered at www.entrynorway.no.

Some passengers are exempt from the requirement to register entry. Any passenger that is exempt from the requirement to register entry according to the Covid-19-regulations section 5 b second paragraph, shall not be denied boarding by the air carrier due to non-registration. The air carrier may rely on the information provided by the passenger when conducting the verification process.
These regulations enter into force 16 December 2021 24:00 (CET).
